channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9364] Get request with multiple columns returns partial results
item.description: When a GET request is issue for a table row with multiple columns and columns have empty qualifier like f1: , results for empty qualifiers is being ignored.
item.summary: Get request with multiple columns returns partial results

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: The problem seems to be with the KeyValue.parseColumn method. The method does not respect empty qualifiers.
Initial patch for 94 branch

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12600491/HBASE-9364.00.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/6958//console

This message is automatically generated.

+ return new byte [][] {family, Bytes.toBytes(StringUtils.EMPTY)};

We have HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY.

diff --git src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/rest/provider/JacksonProvider.java src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/rest/provider/JacksonProvider.java
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..7791d02

Why add a whole new provider for only a test? Is this part of an unrelated change?

There are known problems with the currently used JSON processor, the Jersey one. Using Jackson has been suggested on multiple occasions as a way to resolve those problems, but it will then handle JSON differently, what are the backwards compatibility implications?
Removed Json related changes. I will address them in a separate JIRA.

This message is automatically generated.
Fixed failing unit tests.

-          if (split.length == 2 && split[1].length != 0) {

-            get.addColumn(split[0], split[1]);

+          if (split.length == 2) {

+            if (split[1].length != 0) {

+              get.addColumn(split[0], split[1]);

+            } else {

+              get.addColumn(split[0], HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY);

+            }

No need for the special logic around split[1].length != 0. If it's length == 0, it is an empty byte[].

-          if (!s.contains(":")) {

-            this.columns.add(Bytes.toBytes(s + ":"));

-          } else {

Why do you remove the ':' from the rowspec?

+        	sb.append(Bytes.toStringBinary((byte[])e.getKey()));

+        	sb.append(':');

ws: no tabs please.

-    result = remoteTable.get(get);    

+    result = remoteTable.get(get);

ws: thanks for cleaning these up.

+    define_test "parse_column_name should  return empty qualifier for family-only column specifiers" do

ws: extra space between "should" and "return".

Addressed review comments.

I removed the following logic:

 

if (!s.contains(":")) {

            this.columns.add(Bytes.toBytes(s + ":"));

          } else {

as previously "columnfamily:" was retrieving all column qualifiers for that family. But actually "columnfamily:" means an empty qualifier.
This is a subtle change to the API. What's the (is there a) new way to retrieve all column qualifiers? Let's make sure that's documented in the release notes.
sure Nick Dimiduk. Can you point me the location of the release notes, where I should be updating ?

Can you point me the location of the release notes

Just edit this ticket and there's a release notes field.
Thanks for the clear explanation Vandana Ayyalasomayajula. Unless any further objection is raised, I'll get this committed.
poking buildbot.

Trunk has shifted. Vandana Ayyalasomayajula would you mind rebasing? Thanks.
Rebased according to recent trunk changes.
Nick Dimiduk How does one trigger the HadoopQA to run on the latest patch ?
poking buildbot
This change will modify slightly the API, so I want to get it in for 0.96.
You going to commit Nick Dimiduk (Looked fine on skim)

Buildbot appears awol. Since we had green lights earlier, I will test v3 locally and commit if it's good.

Vandana Ayyalasomayajula I noticed v3 removed the @Test annotation from testLatestCellGetXML. I think this was unintentional. Will restore before testing/applying.
Actually, can I get someone else (cc stack or Jonathan Hsieh) to have a look at the small change to KeyValue?
Nick Dimiduk /tmp is filled on hadoopqa.
Should we even be supporting '...results for empty qualifiers is being ignored.' Sounds perverse? No qualifier getting all columns in a CF makes sense but an empty qualifier? How is that useful?

But using hbase shell and java api, the users can actually assign values to empty qualifier, but can never retrieve them using shell or rest queries. So, to make things consistent, either we remove support for assigning values to empty qualifier or provide support to retrieve values for empty qualifiers. The definition on "columnfamiliy:" is different on different places.

You going to commit Nick Dimiduk (Looked fine on skim)

stack

That's the plan, pending a more informed approval of the KeyValue change. Lacking Mr. Hadoop QA, I'm running through the full suite locally. Just passed hadoop2 profile, now running hadoop1.

FWIW, I agree with Vandana Ayyalasomayajula on the point of no specified qualifier vs empty qualifier.

From HEAD of 0.94:

hbase(main):002:0> create 'foo', 'f1'

0 row(s) in 1.1630 seconds



hbase(main):003:0> put 'foo', 'r1', 'f1:bar', 'baz'

0 row(s) in 0.1010 seconds



hbase(main):004:0> put 'foo', 'r1', 'f1:', 'empty!'

0 row(s) in 0.0810 seconds



hbase(main):005:0> scan 'foo'

ROW                                                 COLUMN+CELL                                                                                                                                           

 r1                                                 column=f1:, timestamp=1379108356015, value=empty!                                                                                                     

 r1                                                 column=f1:bar, timestamp=1379105984271, value=baz                                                                                                     

1 row(s) in 0.1190 seconds

patch v3 passes full tests on both profiles for me. I'm +1

stack any objections to commit?

Agree should be consistent.

If you do scan 'foo', "f1", what happens?

So 0.94 did the right thing Nick Dimiduk (according to your example above) and trunk/0.96 does different? Or your example is w/ the patch in place? This patch fixes trunk and 0.96?

Release note says "The behavior of retrieving values of all the qualifiers of a column family has been changed." Was change in 0.96/trunk?

Demonstrated above, 0.94/HEAD correctly handles displaying a null qualifier value with an unbounded scan.

Over to trunk, it appears we have consistent behavior:

hbase(main):006:0> scan 'foo'

ROW                                                 COLUMN+CELL                                                                                                                                           

 r1                                                 column=f1:, timestamp=1379113061705, value=empty!                                                                                                     

 r1                                                 column=f1:bar, timestamp=1379113067612, value=baz                                                                                                     

1 row(s) in 0.0310 seconds

The scan comment doesn't accept a String for its second argument.

hbase(main):007:0> scan 'foo', 'f1'

ROW                                                 COLUMN+CELL                                                                                                                                           



ERROR: Arguments should be a hash. Failed to parse "f1", String

...

ColumnPrefixFilter appears to work as expected.

hbase(main):022:0> scan 'foo', {FILTER => "(ColumnPrefixFilter (''))"}

ROW                                                 COLUMN+CELL                                                                                                                                           

 r1                                                 column=f1:, timestamp=1379113061705, value=empty!                                                                                                     

 r1                                                 column=f1:bar, timestamp=1379113067612, value=baz                                                                                                     

1 row(s) in 0.0170 seconds

A simple get is kind of surprising though:

hbase(main):024:0> get 'foo', 'r1', 'f1'

COLUMN                                              CELL                                                                                                                                                  

 f1:                                                timestamp=1379113061705, value=empty!                                                                                                                 

 f1:bar                                             timestamp=1379113067612, value=baz                                                                                                                    

2 row(s) in 0.0090 seconds



hbase(main):025:0> get 'foo', 'r1', 'f1:'

COLUMN                                              CELL                                                                                                                                                  

 f1:                                                timestamp=1379113061705, value=empty!                                                                                                                 

 f1:bar                                             timestamp=1379113067612, value=baz                                                                                                                    

2 row(s) in 0.0110 seconds

All that aside though, the point of this patch appears to be bringing the REST interface inline with the others. That is, providing any access at all to lonely foo/r1/f1:.
I'm good w/ bringing REST into line but why does it need KV mods? I'm afraid these mods will change KV behavior in unexpected ways.
Seems like trunk/0.96 act properly in the shell at least?

Stack The behavior between trunk and 0.94 is the same. The shell and REST APIS are using the KV module for parsing the columns (columnfamily:qualifier) . Thats the reason for touching the KV module. If you think this change is intrusive, I can add a utility method in KeyValue class to care of the case of empty qualifier, which can be used only by the hbase shell and REST.
Opened HBASE-9549 to log the inconsistent shell behavior.

Here's the patch rebased onto trunk post HBASE-9549. It's become little more than a new test and whitespace cleanup.

Vandana Ayyalasomayajula, Francis Liu does it still accomplish the needs of the original ticket?

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: The behavior of retrieving values of all the qualifiers of a column family has been changed. Until now, "columnfamily: " , used to fetch all the values belonging to all the qualifiers of a column family, but now on it means empty qualifier. To retrieve all the qualifier values, just the column family has to be specified. In summary specifying only the column family will retrieve all the values associated with all the column qualifiers and specifying "<columnfamily>: " means retrieving value associated with an empty qualifier.
